column6: Operations with significant actual and potential negative impacts on local communities
column13: In 2020, One Rail Australia was responsible for a hydrocarbon spill of about 18,000 L at its Berrimah terminal (NT). As part of the immediate response, the spill was cleaned mainly up (including recovering 25% of the fuel); however, the NT Environment Protection Authority issued a notice requiring the completion of an environmental audit in response to the spill and management of soil remediation activities. Subsequent soil and groundwater assessments were completed under the supervision of an independent auditor. This work and associated reporting were concluded in June 2023, indicating residual hydrocarbons in groundwater and soil on site pose a low risk to site workers and the mangrove environment bordering the terminal.
